data.sentence: The word أَمْ comes from the root ا م and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word بِالْحَقِّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.

data.meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
data.sentence: The word يَقُولُونَ comes from the root ق و ل and is associated with the meanings: to say/speak, to call, to be named, word/speech, utterance, a thing said, greeting, discourse, one who says/speaks. To inspire/transmit/relate/answer/think/profess, emit an opinion on, indicate a state or condition or circumstance. qa'ilun - speaker, indicator.
The word بَلْ comes from the root ب ل and is associated with the meanings:

data.meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive
data.sentence: The word جَاءَهُمْ comes from the root ج ي ا and is associated with the meanings: to come/do, commit, (with preposition bi) to bring, produce, (2:275) to receive

data.meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.
data.sentence: The word وَأَكْثَرُهُمْ comes from the root ك ث ر and is associated with the meanings: To surpass in number or quantity, increase, multiply, happen often; To be much, many, numerous.

data.meanings: To find difficult, dislike, disapprove, feel aversion to, be averse from, loathe, abhor, hate, detest, be unwilling.
data.sentence: The word كَارِهُونَ comes from the root ك ر ه and is associated with the meanings: To find difficult, dislike, disapprove, feel aversion to, be averse from, loathe, abhor, hate, detest, be unwilling.

data.meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.
data.sentence: The word لِلْحَقِّ comes from the root ح ق ق and is associated with the meanings: To be right, just or fitting, worthy of, justly due to, proper, genuine, real, a fact, true, necessitated, suitable, necessary, incumbent upon, suited to the requirement of justice, become certain, authentic, deserve.

data.meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk
data.sentence: The word جِنَّةٌ comes from the root ج ن ن and is associated with the meanings: veiled/concealed/covered/hid/protected (e.g. cloth, armour, grave, shield), invisible, become dark/posessed, darkness of night, bereft of reason, mad/insane/unsound in mind/intellect, confusedness.Become thick/full-grown/blossom, herbage, garden.Spiritual beings that conceal themselves from the senses (including angels), become weak and abject, greater part of mankind, devil/demon, people who are peerless having no match or equal, a being who is highly potent, sometimes refers to Kings because they are concealed from the common folk
